Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6931970539/job/18854871991)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6931970539/job/18854871651)

**[imports]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion import Mathlib.Condensed.Limits import Mathlib.Condensed.Solid import Mathlib.Control.Applicative ```

```suggestion
This file contains the definition of a solid abelian group: `CondensedAb.isSolid`. Solid abelian
```
Should not these two definitions `profiniteSolid` and `profiniteSolidification` be in the `Condensed` namespace?

As this is a definition of a type (actually a `Prop`), it should be capitalized. Theorems saying that a condensed abelian group is solid shall be theorems named `isSolid`.
```suggestion
def CondensedAb.IsSolid (A : CondensedAb.{u}) : Prop :=
```
(For clarity, at the top of the file, you may add a TODO saying that the image of `profiniteSolid` consists of solid abelian groups?)
Then, I am wondering whether `IsSolid` could be made a class? Would not that be helpful when developing the API?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Condensed): definition of solid abelian groups
